description: Engagement scoring: assess whether an argument is worth detailed analysis before investing effort in fallacy detection.

interpretation.0-3: Not engaging in good faith. Likely trolling, venting, or signaling. Don't invest effort.
interpretation.4-5: Borderline. May be frustrated but reachable. Clarify intent before deep analysis.
interpretation.6-7: Reasonable engagement. Worth analyzing and responding substantively.
interpretation.8-10: Strong good-faith argument. Prioritize thoughtful engagement.

positive_signals.name: Steelmanable Position
positive_signals.description: The argument can be reconstructed into a reasonable position that smart people might hold.
positive_signals.check: Can you articulate a version of their argument that you'd have to think hard to refute?

positive_signals.name: Specific Claims
positive_signals.description: Makes concrete, falsifiable claims rather than vague assertions.
positive_signals.check: Are there specific facts, numbers, or scenarios cited that could be verified or disputed?

positive_signals.name: Acknowledges Tradeoffs
positive_signals.description: Recognizes downsides of their position or upsides of opposing views.
positive_signals.check: Do they mention any limitations, costs, or conditions under which they'd be wrong?

positive_signals.name: Responds to Actual Points
positive_signals.description: Addresses what was actually said rather than a caricature.
positive_signals.check: Are they engaging with the specific claims made, or arguing past them?

positive_signals.name: Asks Clarifying Questions
positive_signals.check: Do they ask questions to ensure they understand the position correctly?

positive_signals.name: Willing to Update
positive_signals.description: Shows signs of changing position when presented with new information.
positive_signals.check: Have they acknowledged any points or modified their stance during the exchange?

negative_signals.name: Motte-and-Bailey
negative_signals.description: Switches between a strong controversial claim (bailey) and a weak defensible claim (motte) when challenged.
negative_signals.check: When pressed, do they retreat to a much weaker claim than they originally made?

negative_signals.name: Moving Goalposts
negative_signals.description: Changes the criteria for what would satisfy them after each point is addressed.
negative_signals.check: Have they repeatedly changed what evidence or argument would convince them?

negative_signals.name: Sealioning
negative_signals.description: Persistent demands for evidence/explanation while ignoring what's provided.
negative_signals.check: Are they asking questions in bad faith, ignoring answers, then asking more?

negative_signals.name: Emotional Escalation
negative_signals.description: Increasing hostility, insults, or dramatic language as the discussion continues.
negative_signals.check: Is the tone getting more aggressive without new substantive content?

negative_signals.name: Gish Gallop
negative_signals.description: Overwhelming with many weak arguments rather than defending a few strong ones.
negative_signals.check: Are they throwing out many points without defending any in depth?

negative_signals.name: Kafka Trap
negative_signals.description: Any response is taken as proof of guilt ('your denial proves you're defensive').
negative_signals.check: Is there any response you could give that they wouldn't use against you?

negative_signals.name: Pure Signaling
negative_signals.description: Argument is performative for an audience rather than aimed at truth-seeking.
negative_signals.check: Are they playing to a crowd rather than engaging with you directly?

workflow.step_1: Before detailed fallacy analysis, calculate engagement score
workflow.step_2: Sum positive signals present (each contributes its weight)
workflow.step_3: Sum negative signals present (each subtracts its weight)
workflow.step_6: If score < threshold, consider: (a) disengage, (b) ask clarifying questions, (c) address the audience not the arguer

example_assessment.argument: AI coding tools are just hype. My friend tried Copilot and it wrote buggy code. These companies are lying to sell products. Anyone who disagrees is either naive or being paid.
example_assessment.recommendation: Low engagement score. Not worth detailed fallacy analysis. If responding, address for lurkers, not the arguer.
